page.title: 01HEATHALL
page.content: { {HEATHHALL - LOCHARBRIGGS - KIRKTON GRID REF:02960579 AREA 12 SQ.KM. {TYPE OF LANDSCAPE In the West landscape is flat near the{River Nith,}which is wide and meandering.The floodplain in this area regularly floods during periods of heavy rain in winter.In this western part,most of the land is farmland but is used for grazing. In the central area eg,near{Kirkton is hilly,not large hills caused by gravel and debris from the glaciers The land has some problems like poor drainage in parts of unused land.Most of this land is farmland made up of crops other than grassland.This central part also has a small village called Kirkton which has 3 or 4 minor roads leading to it.
